message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY, cs.SI 

This paper focuses on emotion detection in text using machine learning models, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a new network based on a bidirectional GRU model, which involves deep learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper mentions the potential applications of emotion detection in marketing, political science, psychology, human-computer interaction, and artificial intelligence, which could fall under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.CY (Computers and Society). Finally, the paper discusses the limitations of current methods and proposes a new approach to improve performance, which could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
